alert.note: Alert for City of Manassas; City of Manassas Park; Culpeper; Fairfax; Fauquier; Orange; Prince William; Spotsylvania; Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 28 at 7:01PM EDT until July 28 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Stafford County in northern Virginia... Northeastern Orange County in central Virginia... Southwestern Fairfax County in northern Virginia... Southeastern Fauquier County in northern Virginia... Southeastern Culpeper County in northern Virginia... The southeastern City of Manassas Park in northern Virginia... Southwestern Prince William County in northern Virginia... The City of Manassas in northern Virginia... North central Spotsylvania County in central Virginia... * Until 800 PM EDT. * At 701 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Warrenton to 13 miles southeast of Culpeper, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Dale City, Linton Hall, Bealeton, Manassas, Manassas Park, New Baltimore, Independent Hill, Falmouth, Nokesville, Catlett, Calverton, Midland, Roseville, Garrisonville, Casanova, Flat Run, Ramoth, Heflin, Dunavant and Lake Of The Woods. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: City of Manassas; City of Manassas Park; Culpeper; Fairfax; Fauquier; Orange; Prince William; Spotsylvania; Stafford
